intro: Psychotria microbracteata, commonly known as the small-bract psychotria, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests. The species is notable for its morphological features and ecological role in its native habitat.
